chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact or Sexual Intercourse w/ Person under Age of 13

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Johnnie C Brown

records.addlTxt: Amended Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Johnnie C Brown appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Heather L. Johnson in court with Johnnie C Brown.  Attorney Jack T Eichorst in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Re:  Defense Motion to Adjourn the Final Pretrial and Jury Trial
Re:  State's Notice of Video Recorded Statement.

Defense is willing to waive speedy trial demand in order to properly prepare for the case.  Defense request 60 days to follow up with the expert and investigation.  State has received the DNA report, but is waiting for the DNA analysis of the victim.  Court grants the request.

Court accepts defense waiver of the Speedy Trial Demand.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for January 17, 2023 at 08:30 am.
NOTICE OF MOTION AND MOTION TO ADJOURN FINAL PRE-TRIAL AND JURY TRIAL, received and filed.
NOTICE OF VIDEO RECORDED STATEMENT, received and filed.
received and filed.
received and filed.
FELON PRETRIAL SCHEDULING ORDER, signed and filed.
Entered August 4th and expires November 2nd.

Defendant Johnnie C Brown in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Defendant Johnnie C Brown in custody.  Jack T Eichorst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

State has reviewed the discovery and will provide an index with discovery to defense. Defense may file a Motion to Suppress once discovery is reviewed.

Defense request court not take any action of the defendant's pro se documents.    Defense enters a speedy trial demand.

Court orders case adjourned for Final Pretrial and Jury trial.  Defense motion to be filed by August 25 and state's response by September 8.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion to Suppress Statement.  (Johnnie C. Brown - #2022004745, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion for Speedy Trial.  (Johnnie C. Brown - #2022004745, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).

Defendant Johnnie C Brown in court with Attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Defendant Johnnie C Brown in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer T. Klauser.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.   
Please be advised, Effective July 30, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen R. Brostrom, in Room 506 of the Safety Building.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Johnnie C Brown not in court, defendant in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Attorney Johnson in trial this week. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Johnnie C Brown in court, in custody.  Emily S Zimmel appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Jack T. Eichorst.  No appearance by Attorney Johnson.  Defense Attorney recently retained.  Defendant given an adjourned date for Preliminary Hearing.  Case adjourned.  mn  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Johnnie C Brown not in court, defendant in custody.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a State V. Lee hearing in the trial court.  Hearing scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Johnnie C Brown not in court, defendant in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with C.I.R. (DOB: 11/16/2016) or any minor under the age of 18
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

Defendant Johnnie C Brown in court with attorney Robert W Peterson.  Defendant Johnnie C Brown in custody.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Johnnie C Brown appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.    Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
